channel.title: Mini-article - Java series, that I'm creating
channel.description:
[ul]Hi General Programmer's, I don't really go into this topic, but here I am!
So I'm here today to talk about my series. I'm here to create a Java series for beginner Java developers all the way up to professionals' (if I get there). The aim of this mini-project is to help beginners to understand a bit more about Java, but not only that; it's to help me learn as well! I know there are lots of articles out there teaching the basics behind Java, but I just thought it would be quite fun to create my own mini-article. I intend to make around four individual series, all holding around fifty - hundred text documents. What I mean by Professional; I don't mean guru professional, I mean beginner professional.
[size=14pt][u]Text document sizes?[/u][/size]
The text documents will be no more then 10kb, I don't want you reading over 200kb worth of text for every single document. The only reason for this is that it will take me like a year for each text document and it won't help you learn, you'll just be reading and reading and reading... Though in the harder series the text documents will be some-what bigger.
[size=14pt][u]What I've done so far that the beginner text documents cover;[/u][/size]
[list] [li]Learning the use of Math Operators[/li] [li]Increment Operators[/li] [li]Learning the uses of Scanners'[/li] [li]Variables [/li] [li]Interger's[/li] [li]Creating basic calculators[/li] [li]Use Methods with Parameters[/li] [li]Methods[/li][/list]
[size=14pt][u]The Layout[/u][/size]
There are currently only two series; Intermediate series and Beginner series. I intend to make around four series; Intermediate, Beginner, Hard and Professional. As you can see I'm only on Beginner series and I've hardly started.
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/26/seriestz.jpg/][IMG]http://img26.imageshack.us/img26/8440/seriestz.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/11/beginger.jpg/][IMG]http://img11.imageshack.us/img11/4567/beginger.jpg[/img][/URL]
I do intend to clean it up, maybe by using Visual Basic, yes I know -.-.
[b]It's a very big goal, but I hope I learn just as much as you read.[/b][/ul]

item.title: Mini-article - Java series, that I'm creating
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

This is quite a productive thing you’re doing here, you may wish to spend some time going into depth about classes and basic object orientation before you get onto using operators and fields/variables.

Read full topic

[ul]Hi General Programmer’s, I don’t really go into this topic, but here I am!

So I’m here today to talk about my series. I’m here to create a Java series for beginner Java developers all the way up to professionals’ (if I get there). The aim of this mini-project is to help beginners to understand a bit more about Java, but not only that; it’s to help me learn as well!
I know there are lots of articles out there teaching the basics behind Java, but I just thought it would be quite fun to create my own mini-article. I intend to make around four individual series, all holding around fifty - hundred text documents.
What I mean by Professional; I don’t mean guru professional, I mean beginner professional.

[size=14pt]Text document sizes?[/size]

The text documents will be no more then 10kb, I don’t want you reading over 200kb worth of text for every single document. The only reason for this is that it will take me like a year for each text document and it won’t help you learn, you’ll just be reading and reading and reading…
Though in the harder series the text documents will be some-what bigger.

[size=14pt]What I’ve done so far that the beginner text documents cover;[/size]

[li]Learning the use of Math Operators[/li]

[li]Learning the uses of Scanners’[/li]

[li]Interger’s[/li]

[li]Methods[/li][/list]
